reason.tex: %text The following properties of determinants can be useful in simplifying it and thus reducing the calculation required to establish its final value. % \begin{tabular}{|c|c|} \hline \text{Interchanging the rows and columns of a} & C_i\leftrightarrow R_i \\ \text{determinant does not change its value} & |D|=|D| \\ \hline \text{If any two rows (or columns) are inter-} & R_i\leftrightarrow R_j \\ \text{-changed, the sign of determinant changes} & |D|=-|D| \\ \hline \text{If any two rows (or columns) are identical} & R_i=kR_j \\ \text{or proportional, determinant is zero} & |D|=0 \\ \hline \text{If a row (or column) is multiplied by a } & R_i\rightarrow kR_i \\ \text{constant $k$, its value is multipled by $k$} & |D|=k|D| \\ \hline \text{If $k$ times a row (or column) is added to} & R_i\rightarrow kR_i\pm R_j \\ \text{another row (or col), value is the same} & |D|=|D| \\ \hline \end{tabular} \\
